alert.note: Alert for Riverside County Mountains; San Bernardino County Mountains (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 30 at 9:38PM PST until February 02 at 4:00PM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING THROUGH FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Heavy snow and gusty winds possible. 3 to 6 inches possible between 6000-7000 feet, 6-18 inches between 7000- 8000 feet, and 18-24 inches above 8000 feet. 1-3 inches possible 4500-6000 feet.Southerly winds gusting 40 to 50 mph Thursday becoming westerly with gusts to 50 mph possible late Thursday into Friday. * WHERE...San Bernardino County Mountains and Riverside County Mountains. * WHEN...From 5 AM Thursday through 4 PM Friday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels on Thursday will be 6500- 7000 ft before steadily falling to 4500 feet early Friday morning. Highest snowfall rates Thursday morning and afternoon, turning to occasional light to moderate snow showers Thursday night into Friday.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: Riverside County Mountains; San Bernardino County Mountains
